intro: Vernonia giannasii, commonly known as the Giannasii ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces striking purple to violet flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. Vernonia giannasii is typically found in dry, open habitats such as scrublands and rocky areas. Its unique appearance and limited distribution make it a notable species in botanical studies.
